message: While CouchDBX is very fine indeed, I've always wanted to have a single installer experience across all platforms.  I started creating one in PyQt.  Almost there.  Any comments, critiques, yells, guffaws?
With the amount of time they've had, I don't find this list very impressive: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PyQt#Notable_applications_that_use_PyQt
*sigh* I wish Titanium was further along with their desktop goals...

Yeah, I'm not attached to PyQt - bottom line if we want a a cross platform installer for CouchDB we need some cross platform skeleton which has an easy way to start and stop OS processes, communicate over sockets/pipes with the processes and also render a web browser widget preferably webkit based.  I think may be other things like AdobeAIR and Silverlight may also work - I just am not sure of their ability to manage and communicate with OS processes - so any suggestions about alternatives?
The fonts don't look right and it inexplicably asked me to sign up. Come to think of it, if Titanium Desktop worked just as expected, it would be way more popular than it is.
